rationale:
While the PS for the PL subsystem is not enabled, HK PL shall transmit the HK data of the PL subsystem through the TC/TM service. 
state PS for the PL subsystem not enabled: disabledPS_PL
action transmit HK data of the PL subsystem through the TC/TM service: transmit_I2C_TTC

rationale:
HK PL shall handle HK data from the PL subsystem every TBD seconds, as long as the handling of HK data is enabled. 
TBD seconds pass is environmental event: ENV_HKPL_TBD_PASS
state handling of HK data is enabled: HK_PL_enabled_data_handling
action HK data from the PL subystem: HK_PL_begin_data_handling

rationale: After 10 seconds of Computation at an execution frequency of 10 hz, the Output should equal 10 within a +/- 0.1 tolerance, for a Constant Input (xin = 1.0), and the sample delta time T = 0.1 seconds when in normal mode of operation.
fulltext: When in NORMAL mode  when EXEC_FREQ = 10 & XIN = 1.0 & T = 0.1, TUSTIN_INTEGRATOR shall, after 10 seconds, satisfy YOUT <= 10.1 & YOUT >=9.9

semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition ((EXEC_FREQ = 10 & XIN = 1.0 & T = 0.1)) holds, component TUSTIN_INTEGRATOR shall , after 10 seconds, satisfy YOUT <= 10.1 & YOUT >= 9.9. Note that this requirement is only imposed when TUSTIN_INTEGRATOR is in mode NORMAL.

rationale: 2. The Inner Loop Pitch Regulator Shall not command angular pitch accelerations greater than the capability of the system (50 deg/sec2) for durations exceeding 100 frames (1 second @ 100 hz).

rationale: 1. When Reset is True and the Initial Condition (ic) is bounded by the provided Top and Bottom Limits (BL <= ic <= TL), the Output (yout) shall equal the Initial Condition (ic).

rationale: a. After 10 seconds of Computation at an execution frequency of 10 hz, the Output should equal 10 within a +/- 0.1 tolerance, for a Constant Input (xin = 1.0), and the sample delta time T = 0.1 seconds when in normal mode of operation.
fulltext: when EXEC_FREQ = 10.0 & XIN = 10.0 & T = 0.1, Tustin_Integrator shall, after 10 seconds, satisfy 9.0 <= YOUT & YOUT <= 10.0

rationale: Over a 10 second computational duration at an execution frequency of 10 hz, the Output should equal the sine of time t, sin(t), where time is defined as a vector from 0 to 10 by increments of 0.1 seconds within a +/- 0.1 tolerance for an input equal to the cosine of time t, cos(t), with the sample delta time T = 0.1 seconds when in normal mode of operation.
fulltext: when input = ts(0,10,1/10,cos) Tustin_Integrator shall, within 10 seconds, satisfy max(abs(output - ts(0,10,1/10,sin))) < 1/10

semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition input = ts ( 0 10 , 1 / 10 , cos ) holds, component Tustin_Integrator shall , within 10 seconds, satisfy max ( abs ( output - ts ( 0 10 , 1 / 10 , sin ) ) ) < 1 / 10.

rationale: 3. When in normal operation, the output shall be the result of the equation, yout = T/2*(xin + xinpv)+ ypv
fulltext: when ! RESET & BL <= YOUT & YOUT <= TL, Tustin_Integrator shall  satisfy YOUT = T/2.0*(XIN + XIN_PV) + YOUT_PV

semantics.ltlFormula: G (! RESET & BL <= YOUT & YOUT <= TL -> YOUT = T / 2.0 * ( XIN + XIN_PV ) + YOUT_PV)
semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition ! RESET & BL <= YOUT & YOUT <= TL holds, component Tustin_Integrator shall satisfy YOUT = T / 2.0 * ( XIN + XIN_PV ) + YOUT_PV.

rationale: The autopilot shall change states from NOMINAL to STANDBY when the pilot is in control (standby).
fulltext: if NOMINAL & standby  AUTOPILOT  shall  transition to STANDBY

semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition ((NOMINAL & standby)) holds, component AUTOPILOT shall perform action: transition to STANDBY.

rationale: When Reset is True and the Initial Condition (ic) is bounded by the provided Top and Bottom Limits (BL <= ic <= TL), the Output (yout) shall equal the Initial Condition (ic).
fulltext: When in RESET mode,  when BL <= IC & IC <= TL, Tustin_integrator  shall  satisfy YOUT = IC

semantics.ltlFormula: G (RESET IMP (BL <= IC & IC <= TL IMP YOUT = IC))
semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition BL <= IC & IC <= TL holds, component Tustin_integrator shall satisfy YOUT = IC. Note that this requirement is only imposed when Tustin_integrator is in mode RESET.

rationale:
Exceeding sensor limits shall latch an autopilot pullup when the pilot is not in control (not standby) and the system is supported without failures (not apfail).   
Event Sensor limits (boolean): limits
Event Autopilot pullup(boolean): pullup 
State pilot not in control: !standby
State system is supported without failures: !apfail
fulltext: when limits & !standby & !apfail AUTOPILOT shall  initiate pullup

semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition ((limits & ! standby & ! apfail)) holds, component AUTOPILOT shall perform action: initiate pullup.

ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution.
TRIGGER: first point in the interval.
REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must hold at all time points between (and including) the trigger and the end of the interval.

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in every interval where M holds. TRIGGER: first point in the interval if (COND) is true and any point in the interval where (COND) becomes true (from false). REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must remain true until (but not necessarily including) the point where the stop condition holds, or to the end of the interval. If the stop condition never occurs, RES must hold until the end of the scope, or forever. If the stop condition holds at the trigger, the requirement is satisfied.

rationale:
2.	When a low speed warning is allowed, as computed by the SWIM Airspeed algorithm, a low speed warning shall be true when the vehicle air data impact pressure is less than the warning trigger for minimum impact pressure in which a safe AGCAS evasive maneuver can be accomplished where:

The warning trigger for minimum impact pressure in which a safe AGCAS evasive maneuver can be accomplished is computed as

SWIM_Qcmin_lbspft2 = [(-2.0906 + 0.020306*Auto GCAS Minimum Vcas) + 0.1] * (70.7184 (lbspft2/in Hg))

rationale:
The SWIM Airspeed algorithm shall output the minimum AGCAS airspeed required to perform a 2g flyup as follows:

Auto GCAS Minimum Vcas (knots) = 
SQRT{[2*Load Factor*Gross Weight]/[Air Density at sea level * 
		Coefficient of Lift Max*Wing Area]} / 1.6891 (ft/s/knots)
where
	Load Factor = 2 gs
	Gross weight of the aircraft
	Air Density at sea level = 0.0023769 slugs/ft^3
	Coefficient of Lift Max = 1.24 (CAT I) and 1.10 (CAT III)
	Wing Area of the F-16 = 300 ft^2
Thus,
IF CAT I, Auto GCAS Minimum Vcas (knots)  = 1.25921 * SQRT(Gross Weight)  + 10.0
IF CAT III, Auto GCAS Minimum Vcas (knots)  = 1.33694 * SQRT(Gross Weight) + 10.0

semantics.ltlDescription: If the condition altitude_control_mode_selected & ! FPA_control_mode_selected & ! stick_manual_pitch_command & ! stick_manual_roll_command holds, component FSW shall perform action: start altitude_control.

fulltext: when x > 0 and if ! p, the system shall  increment the frammitz counter

semantics.ltlDescription:
Whenever the condition x > 0 & ! p holds, the action increment the frammitz counter must happen afterwards eventually.
The condition may hold several times before the action happens.

rationale: Because.

fulltext: before ChannelSelection, television shall  first enable Power and then enable Roku

semantics.ltlFormula: (F ChannelSelection) -> ((!(((!((!enable Roku) & enable Power)) & (!ChannelSelection)) U (enable Roku & (!((!enable Roku) & enable Power))))) & ((!ChannelSelection) U enable Roku))
semantics.ltlDescription: Component television shall perform enable Power strictly before enable Roku. Strictly before means that enable Roku cannot occur at the same time as enable Power.. Note that this requirement is only relevant and imposed before television enters mode ChannelSelection for the first time.

input.responsesField: first enable Power and then enable Roku

fulltext: abc shall, after 10 seconds, satisfy Q

semantics.description: ENFORCED: in the interval defined by the entire execution. TRIGGER: first point in the interval. REQUIRES: for every trigger, RES must be false at all time points with distance <=10 from the trigger (i.e., trigger, trigger+1, ..., and trigger+10). Moreover, RES must hold at the point that is at distance 10+1 from the trigger, that is, trigger+10+1, except if the end of the interval occurs earlier.

fulltext: before ChannelSelection, television shall  first satisfy power_on and then satisfy roku_on

Note that this requirement is only relevant and imposed before television enters mode ChannelSelection for the first time.
